techmeme.title: ByteDance hires a new global general counsel, John Rogovin, who spent 12 years as Warner Bros.' top lawyer and worked in the US FCC and DOJ (Kurt Wagner/Bloomberg)
Qualcomm claims Snapdragon chips will come to "all PC form factors" including desktops, and Snapdragon X Elite has 2.6x the performance per watt vs. Apple's M3 (Les Pounder/Tom's Hardware)
Sources: Microsoft is laying off hundreds of employees in Azure; one source estimated the Azure for Operators team cuts involved as many as 1,500 staffers (Ashley Stewart/Business Insider)
Coinbase says it has donated another $25M to the pro-crypto Fairshake SuperPAC; Fairshake has raised ~$161M for 2024's US election from a16z, Ripple, and others (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)
Sources: LoanSnap, an AI mortgage startup that raised ~$100M, has been sued by at least seven creditors, including Wells Fargo, and state and federal agencies (TechCrunch)
